Class L3Handler

  • java.lang.Object
    • L3Handler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    L3ShimListener

    public class L3Handler
extends java.lang.Object
implements L3ShimListener
    This abstract class represents a L3 object that can send and receive L3 frames.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      L3Handler(Layer2Endpoint l2e, int netPart)
      Create a L3Handler, given a layer 2 endpoint, and the network part of the L3Address.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • L3Handler

        public L3Handler(Layer2Endpoint l2e,
         int netPart)
        Create a L3Handler, given a layer 2 endpoint, and the network part of the L3Address. The host part comes from the L2 address in the layer 2 endpoint. The code creates an L3Shim object (and storing it), sets itself as a listener for that object, and creates and stores the L3Address for this object, from the given netPart and layer 2's unique Mac address.

    • Method Detail

      • setListener

        public void setListener(L3Listener l)
        Store a reference to a listener for packets received here.

      • send

        public void send(L3Packet pkt)
        Given a frame, convert it to a string of bits and send it using the L3Shim on layer 2 "below".

      • dropReceivedPacket

        public boolean dropReceivedPacket(L3Packet pkt,
                         java.lang.String bits)
        Drop any received packet that isn't for this interface. We'll override this in a router implementation that receives all packets and forwards packets not destined for it.

      • packetReceived

        public void packetReceived(Layer2Endpoint l2e,
                  java.lang.String bits)
        Called when the layer below receives bits successfully. Like the layer 2 implementation, it calls dropReceivedPacket to determine if the received packet should be dropped, instead of passed on through the listener packetReceived() callback to the higher layer.
        Specified by:
        packetReceived in interface L3ShimListener

      • getAddr

        public L3Address getAddr()
